events.name: North Korea fires ballistic missile ahead of US-South Korea military drill
events.wd_label: North Korea fires ballistic missile ahead of US-South Korea military drill
events.wd_description: North Korea fired a ballistic missile towards the sea off its east coast ahead of planned military drills by South Korea and the US, which involve an aircraft carrier and a visit by US Vice President Kamala Harris to the region.
events.description: North Korea fired a ballistic missile towards the sea off its east coast ahead of planned military drills by South Korea and the US, which involve an aircraft carrier and a visit by US Vice President Kamala Harris to the region.

events.name: missile launch details
events.wd_description: South Korea's military reported that a single, short-range ballistic missile was fired from near the Teachon area of North Pyongyang Province, flying about 600 km at an altitude of 60 km and speed of Mach 5.
events.description: South Korea's military reported that a single, short-range ballistic missile was fired from near the Teachon area of North Pyongyang Province, flying about 600 km at an altitude of 60 km and speed of Mach 5.

events.name: South Korea's military response
events.wd_description: South Korea's Joint Chiefs of Staff condemned the missile launch as a grave provocation that threatens the peace and security of the Korean peninsula and the international community.
events.description: South Korea's Joint Chiefs of Staff condemned the missile launch as a grave provocation that threatens the peace and security of the Korean peninsula and the international community.

events.name: joint discussion by South Korea and US forces
events.wd_label: joint discussion by South Korea and US forces
events.wd_description: The Joint Chiefs of Staff of South Korea and the US Forces Korea Commander discussed the situation and their readiness to respond to any threat from North Korea.
events.description: The Joint Chiefs of Staff of South Korea and the US Forces Korea Commander discussed the situation and their readiness to respond to any threat from North Korea.

events.name: South Korea's economic support offer rejected by North Korea
events.wd_label: South Korea's economic support offer rejected by North Korea
events.wd_description: North Korea rejected South Korea's offer of economic support in exchange for denuclearization, with Kim Yo Jong criticizing President Yoon Suk Yeol's proposal.
events.description: North Korea rejected South Korea's offer of economic support in exchange for denuclearization, with Kim Yo Jong criticizing President Yoon Suk Yeol's proposal.

events.name: South Korea's offer
events.wd_description: South Korea offered economic support to North Korea in exchange for denuclearization.
events.description: South Korea offered economic support to North Korea in exchange for denuclearization.

events.name: Kim Yo Jong's response
events.wd_description: Kim Yo Jong, the younger sister of Kim Jong Un, rejected the offer, criticizing President Yoon Suk Yeol as "really simple" and stating that North Korea would not sit face to face with South Korea.
events.description: Kim Yo Jong, the younger sister of Kim Jong Un, rejected the offer, criticizing President Yoon Suk Yeol as "really simple" and stating that North Korea would not sit face to face with South Korea.

events.name: Unification Ministry's response
events.wd_description: The Unification Ministry in South Korea responded that North Korea distorted South Korea's idea and indicated its intention to continue nuclear development.
events.description: The Unification Ministry in South Korea responded that North Korea distorted South Korea's idea and indicated its intention to continue nuclear development.

events.name: initial proposal by Yoon
events.wd_description: President Yoon Suk Yeol first proposed the swap of economic cooperation for denuclearization during his inauguration speech in May.
events.description: President Yoon Suk Yeol first proposed the swap of economic cooperation for denuclearization during his inauguration speech in May.

events.name: Xi Jinping and Vladimir Putin to meet at SCO summit
events.wd_label: Xi Jinping and Vladimir Putin to meet at SCO summit
events.wd_description: Chinese leader Xi Jinping and Russian President Vladimir Putin will meet on the sidelines of the Shanghai Cooperation Organization (SCO) summit in Uzbekistan next week, marking their first face-to-face meeting since Russia invaded Ukraine.
events.description: Chinese leader Xi Jinping and Russian President Vladimir Putin will meet on the sidelines of the Shanghai Cooperation Organization (SCO) summit in Uzbekistan next week, marking their first face-to-face meeting since Russia invaded Ukraine.

events.name: announcement by Russian envoy
events.wd_description: Russian Envoy to Beijing, Andrey Desinov, announced that Xi Jinping and Vladimir Putin will meet at the SCO summit in Uzbekistan.
events.description: Russian Envoy to Beijing, Andrey Desinov, announced that Xi Jinping and Vladimir Putin will meet at the SCO summit in Uzbekistan.

events.name: significance of the meeting
events.wd_description: The expected meeting will be the first face-to-face encounter between Xi Jinping and Vladimir Putin since Russia invaded Ukraine.
events.description: The expected meeting will be the first face-to-face encounter between Xi Jinping and Vladimir Putin since Russia invaded Ukraine.

events.name: Xi Jinping's first overseas trip since the pandemic
events.wd_label: Xi Jinping's first overseas trip since the pandemic
events.wd_description: This trip will be Xi Jinping's first overseas trip since the early days of the pandemic and comes just weeks before a major political meeting in Beijing.
events.description: This trip will be Xi Jinping's first overseas trip since the early days of the pandemic and comes just weeks before a major political meeting in Beijing.

events.name: importance of Russia-China relationship
events.wd_description: The scheduled meeting and the choice of destination for Xi's first overseas trip signal the importance of the Russia-China relationship, despite international backlash against Moscow since the Ukraine war.
events.description: The scheduled meeting and the choice of destination for Xi's first overseas trip signal the importance of the Russia-China relationship, despite international backlash against Moscow since the Ukraine war.

events.name: EV battery supply chain transformation under the Inflation Reduction Act of 2022
events.wd_label: EV battery supply chain transformation under the Inflation Reduction Act of 2022
events.wd_description: The Inflation Reduction Act of 2022 aims to promote the US production of electric vehicles, renewable energy technologies, and critical minerals by revising the tax credit for EVs and imposing new sourcing requirements.
events.description: The Inflation Reduction Act of 2022 aims to promote the US production of electric vehicles, renewable energy technologies, and critical minerals by revising the tax credit for EVs and imposing new sourcing requirements.

events.name: revised EV tax credit
events.wd_description: The Inflation Reduction Act revises the existing US tax credit of $7,500 for qualifying EVs, eliminating the 200,000 vehicle limit and making substantial changes to eligibility criteria.
events.description: The Inflation Reduction Act revises the existing US tax credit of $7,500 for qualifying EVs, eliminating the 200,000 vehicle limit and making substantial changes to eligibility criteria.

events.name: t: North American assembly requirement
events.wd_description: To qualify as a "clean vehicle" eligible for the revised credit, the final assembly of the vehicle must occur within North America.
events.description: To qualify as a "clean vehicle" eligible for the revised credit, the final assembly of the vehicle must occur within North America.

events.name: t: critical minerals and battery components requirement
events.wd_label: t: critical minerals and battery components requirement
events.wd_description: The tax credit is split based on meeting critical minerals and battery components requirements, with specific percentages increasing over time.
events.description: The tax credit is split based on meeting critical minerals and battery components requirements, with specific percentages increasing over time.

events.name: vent: critical minerals requirement
events.wd_description: A percentage of battery metal value must be extracted or processed in the United States or a free trade agreement partner, starting at 40% in 2023 and increasing to 80% by 2027.
events.description: A percentage of battery metal value must be extracted or processed in the United States or a free trade agreement partner, starting at 40% in 2023 and increasing to 80% by 2027.

events.name: vent: battery components requirement
events.wd_description: A percentage of battery components must be manufactured or assembled in North America, starting at 50% in 2023 and increasing to 100% by 2029.
events.description: A percentage of battery components must be manufactured or assembled in North America, starting at 50% in 2023 and increasing to 100% by 2029.

events.name: critical mineral requirements
events.wd_description: Vehicles are only eligible for the tax credit if critical minerals in the battery are extracted or processed in the United States or free trade partner countries, with increasing percentage requirements over time.
events.description: Vehicles are only eligible for the tax credit if critical minerals in the battery are extracted or processed in the United States or free trade partner countries, with increasing percentage requirements over time.

events.name: t: starting percentage requirements
events.wd_description: Starting in 2023, 40% of the critical minerals in the vehicle battery must be sourced from a US free trade agreement partner or recycled in North America.
events.description: Starting in 2023, 40% of the critical minerals in the vehicle battery must be sourced from a US free trade agreement partner or recycled in North America.

events.name: t: increasing percentage requirements
events.wd_description: The required percentage of critical minerals will increase gradually to 80% by 2027.
events.description: The required percentage of critical minerals will increase gradually to 80% by 2027.

events.name: battery component requirements
events.wd_description: To qualify for the tax credit, a certain percentage of the vehicle battery's components must be manufactured or assembled in North America, with increasing percentages over time.
events.description: To qualify for the tax credit, a certain percentage of the vehicle battery's components must be manufactured or assembled in North America, with increasing percentages over time.

events.name: t: starting percentage requirements
events.wd_description: Starting in 2023, 50% of the battery components must be manufactured or assembled in North America.
events.description: Starting in 2023, 50% of the battery components must be manufactured or assembled in North America.

events.name: t: increasing percentage requirements
events.wd_description: The required percentage of battery components will increase gradually to 100% by 2029.
events.description: The required percentage of battery components will increase gradually to 100% by 2029.

events.name: exclusion of foreign entities
events.wd_description: The tax credit will be prohibited for vehicles with any critical minerals or components sourced from foreign entities of concern, such as China and Russia.
events.description: The tax credit will be prohibited for vehicles with any critical minerals or components sourced from foreign entities of concern, such as China and Russia.

events.name: t: exclusion of critical minerals
events.wd_description: Starting in 2024, vehicles with any critical minerals sourced from foreign entities of concern will be ineligible for the tax credit.
events.description: Starting in 2024, vehicles with any critical minerals sourced from foreign entities of concern will be ineligible for the tax credit.

events.name: t: exclusion of battery components
events.wd_description: Starting in 2023, vehicles with any battery components sourced from foreign entities of concern will be ineligible for the tax credit.
events.description: Starting in 2023, vehicles with any battery components sourced from foreign entities of concern will be ineligible for the tax credit.

events.name: incentives for alternative supply chains
events.wd_description: The EV consumer tax credits under the Inflation Reduction Act are intended to incentivize investments in alternative mineral supply chains.
events.description: The EV consumer tax credits under the Inflation Reduction Act are intended to incentivize investments in alternative mineral supply chains.

events.name: t: need for diversification
events.wd_description: Diversification of battery supply chains is crucial to reduce underinvestment, political risk, and poor governance in the critical minerals value chain.
events.description: Diversification of battery supply chains is crucial to reduce underinvestment, political risk, and poor governance in the critical minerals value chain.

events.name: t: inclusion of processing alongside extraction
events.wd_label: t: inclusion of processing alongside extraction
events.wd_description: Including processing alongside extraction can help meet the increasing stringency of sourcing requirements between 2023 and 2027.
events.description: Including processing alongside extraction can help meet the increasing stringency of sourcing requirements between 2023 and 2027.

events.name: t: inclusion of FTA countries
events.wd_description: Including FTA countries as qualifying sources of mineral supply suggests room to consider several other like-minded partner countries to build a robust supply chain.
events.description: Including FTA countries as qualifying sources of mineral supply suggests room to consider several other like-minded partner countries to build a robust supply chain.

events.name: challenges and recommendations
events.wd_description: There are significant challenges in meeting the sourcing requirements, but the Inflation Reduction Act provides opportunities for refinement and support for supply chain development.
events.description: There are significant challenges in meeting the sourcing requirements, but the Inflation Reduction Act provides opportunities for refinement and support for supply chain development.

events.name: t: clarification on foreign entities
events.wd_description: Clarification is needed on the blanket ban on inputs from foreign entities of concern, particularly China, to allow supply chains to adjust over time.
events.description: Clarification is needed on the blanket ban on inputs from foreign entities of concern, particularly China, to allow supply chains to adjust over time.

events.name: t: multilateral strategy on extraction and processing
events.wd_label: t: multilateral strategy on extraction and processing
events.wd_description: A US and multilateral strategy on extraction and processing is needed to develop supply chains at the ambitious pace envisioned in the Inflation Reduction Act.
events.description: A US and multilateral strategy on extraction and processing is needed to develop supply chains at the ambitious pace envisioned in the Inflation Reduction Act.
